newsitem.title: USA: Safeguard sets Diamond rights offering.
newsitem.headline: Safeguard sets Diamond rights offering.

text.p: Safeguard Scientifics Inc said on Tuesday its proposal to distribute rights to its shareholders to buy 3.2 million common shares of management consulting firm Diamond Technology Partners Inc became effective on Monday.
Safeguard Scientifics is a Diamond shareholder.
It is anticipated that the ex-rights date for trading in Safeguard stock will be February 26. Safeguard shares traded before the ex-rights date will be traded with the rights.

The rights offering will be made on the basis of one share of Diamond common stock for each 10 shares of Safeguard common owned. Each right will entitle the holder to buy one Diamond Class A common stock at $5.50 until the close of business on March 31.
Persons may not exercise rights for fewer than 50 shares of Diamond Class A common.
Chicago-based Diamond is a management consulting firm that devises business strategies enabled by information technology to improve its clients' competitive positions.
